alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern Lincoln County; Jemez Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Chaves County; Southwest Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 04 at 5:52AM MDT until April 04 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph with locally higher gusts of 70 to perhaps 80 mph over Lincoln and southwest Chaves counties. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, northeast, southeast, and west central New Mexico. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing dust will restrict visibility.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.
